data.text: @karamballes That's an awful lot of kids as to make the pathology one of a general type to be experienced by all, to varying degrees of course. We need to nail down the question of attrition with repeat infections.
@MarkJohnsonTw @karamballes @jneill Confounded by the fact that the majority of Covid-19 infection was not confirmed by positive test.

@simone_s_86 @jhnfgn @LGBTTeacherUK @karamballes It is.  Avoiding #LongCovid from one infection is no protection from #LongCovid in subsequent infections.

The only protection is not to be infected in the first place.

The only way to win is not to play.
- WOPR

@jhnfgn @LGBTTeacherUK @karamballes It depends on whether the likelihood of getting Long Covid is a new dice rolled at each infection regardless of the outcomes of previous ones. If it is, then it looks pretty awful.
@frizzbee30 @karamballes I think you are correct, so the number goes up post-omicron wave.

@emceebeere @karamballes Yes I think there will be many more children whose parents and/or GPs are not taking it seriously. If they are not losing weight and can still go to school, they must be fine!
@jhnfgn @LGBTTeacherUK @karamballes er.... I was just responding to your query......🤷‍♀️
@FUFowlers @LGBTTeacherUK @karamballes Unless you plan on repeating lockdown and closing schools a substantial part of that time isn't reflective of reality 2022-
